thread.title: Gareth Bale to make first Real Madrid start in over three months against Villarreal
thread.title_full: Gareth Bale to make first Real Madrid start in over three months against Villarreal

author: Liam Corless
title: Gareth Bale to make first Real Madrid start in over three months against Villarreal
text:
Gareth Bale to make first Real Madrid start in over three months against Villarreal The Welshman has appeared as a substitute in Madrid's last two matches after a serious ankle injury Share Gareth Bale is in line to start for Real Madrid against Villarreal (Photo: Real Madrid) Share   Thank you for subscribing!   
Gareth Bale will start a Real Madrid match for the first time since last November when Los Merengues travel to Villarreal on Sunday night. 
The Welshman suffered a serious ankle injury in a Champions League game against Sporting Lisbon on November 22 which kept him out for three months. 
Bale has made two substitute appearances this month - against Espanyol and Valencia - and Zinedine Zidane is ready to recall him to the starting XI for the trip to Estadio de la Ceramica. 
"He's back at 100%. He's been training at full pace with us for a few days now and he's 100% fit," Zidane said in his pre-match press conference. Bale came on as a sub against Espanyol and scored on February 18 (Photo: Helios de la Rubia) Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
